Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: New lab techniques, how to write a report.
I learned how to develop a plan of attack for a research problem, write a proposal, carry out the research, and summarize the results and what went wrong.
A lot of wet lab skills such as cell culturing, western blots
Lab techniques relevant to the lab I work in.

It is a great independent research opportunity for credit. Perhaps more interaction between lab PIs/mentors and course instructors could be helpful so members of lab understand the requirements and expectations.

I think the final paper has maybe a bit unnecessarily long page requirement. You only get to do like 2 weeks worth of work if you were full time as you do in a full semester of this course. It is hard to write 12-15 pages on 2 weeks worth of work.
I can have a chance to experience the grad-school life
The freedom and flexibility is a huge strength. Weakness: I wish we had a few meetings with the course directors.

Strength- there is some compensation for the work that we do in lab that is usually unpaid. 
Weakness- it is only pass/fail, which does not reflect the amount of work students put in. If it was graded on a letter scale it would be much more fair.
Yes! It is a great opportunity to conduct independent research in a lab.

Depends on your PI and your lab! My lab really helps me to learn a lot, as does my P.I., and they are all very invested in my success in research. As a result, I felt like I was nurtured a lot and this lab was very helpful. Was definitely more than 10 hours a week.
If you have the time (and that is a big if) and you are interested in continuing research during the semester then this course is a great way to keep your feet wet.
Yes, but bare in mind that some experiments/procedures take a long time e.g. 6-10 hours and you must complete them in one go; make sure you can afford the time
Yes if you are working in a lab you might as well get credit for it!
Yes. If you are conducting unpaid research in a lab during the semester take this course.
